result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher F. Nizinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or at any time defendant does not meet that requirement, defendant must complete 10 hours of community service per week.

No contact with victim J.S. unless approved by PO.
Absolute sobriety unless prescribed medications under authority of doctor/PO.

Completion of SAFE program.
Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
190 days credit if revoked on each count.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Zach Glascock.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Strangulation/Suffocation/Repeater/DA/DA Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 2 (Battery/Repeater/DA/DA Repeater) >>NO CONTEST
Ct. 3 (DC/Repeater/DA/DA Repeater>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: 4 years TOTAL: 2 years incarceration and 2 years ES on each count, concurrent, I&S; Defendant placed on 3 years Probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS>>On Ct. 2 only -- 175 days MCJ w/huber for work if defendant qualifies under jail classification system; Completion of SAFE Program; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Absolute sobriety unless prescribed medicationsand under authority of doctor/PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or at any time defendant does not meet that requirement, defendant must complete 10 hours of community service/week; N/C with victim J.S. unless as approved by PO; CC including two D.A; DNA sample and surcharge.

>>>If revoked credit for time served of 190 days on each count
>>>Defendant does not qualify for CIP  but is eligible for SAP
